message.content: This question assesses knowledge about sedimentary rocks. Sedimentary rocks are formed when layers of sediment are deposited and then compressed and packed tightly over time. Option (A) is incorrect because sedimentary rocks are not formed by fusing sediment with lava. Option (B) is incorrect because sedimentary rocks are not formed by packing sediment into tummies. Option (C) is incorrect because sedimentary rocks are not formed by watering sediment with salt.

This question requires basic knowledge about rock types and how sedimentary rocks are formed. Sedimentary rocks are formed when sediment, which can include particles of minerals, rocks, and organic matter, is deposited and then compacted and cemented together over time. Option (A) is incorrect because sedimentary rocks are not formed by fusing with lava. Option (B) is nonsensical and not related to the formation of sedimentary rocks. Option (C) is incorrect because sedimentary rocks are not formed by watering with salt. Option (D) is correct because sedimentary rocks are formed when sediment is packed tightly.

This question requires basic knowledge about sedimentary rocks. Sedimentary rocks are formed when sediments, which can include fragments of rock, minerals, and organic materials, are deposited and become compacted and cemented over time. Option (A) is incorrect because sedimentary rocks are not formed from the fusion of sediment with lava, which would create igneous rocks. Option (B) is nonsensical and not related to the formation of sedimentary rocks. Option (C) is incorrect because saltwater does not play a direct role in the formation of sedimentary rocks. Option (D) is correct because sedimentary rocks are formed when sediments are packed tightly and become compacted.

This question requires knowledge about sedimentary rocks. Sedimentary rocks are formed when sediment, such as pieces of broken rock, shells, and other materials, are compacted and cemented together over time. Option (A) is incorrect because sedimentary rocks are not formed by fusing with lava, which is associated with igneous rocks. Option (B) is unrelated to the process of rock formation. Option (C) is incorrect because the presence of salt does not directly impact the formation of sedimentary rocks. Option (D) is the correct answer because sediment in sedimentary rocks is compacted tightly over time.

Option (D) is correct because sedimentary rocks are formed when layers of sediment are packed tightly and eventually harden into rock.
